definition: to hasten/to hurry/to walk fast/to approach/to tend towards/to converge

sentences.english: Considerable cross-national convergence in life expectancy will occur.
sentences.chinese: 预期寿命将会出现可观的跨国趋同。

sentences.english: Economic globalization has also led to cultural homogenization.
sentences.chinese: 经济全球化也导致了文化的趋同性。

sentences.english: The “great convergence” is an epoch-making transformation.
sentences.chinese: “大趋同”是一个划时代的转变。

sentences.english: Plants had gradually evolved along diverging and converging pathways.
sentences.chinese: 植物是沿着趋异和趋同两种途径逐渐演化的。

sentences.english: In the later stage of Shang dynasty and later, the structure was convergent.
sentences.chinese: 商晚期后，形制趋同，体现了礼制的规范与完善。
心理学家称此为“趋同思维”。

sentences.english: The convergent inclination in universities is the result of legality mechanism.
sentences.chinese: 高校的趋同性正是合法性机制作用的结果。

sentences.english: Promote convergence of standards for harvesting metadata.
sentences.chinese: 推进获取元数据的标准趋同化。

sentences.english: And that makes all the difference in the world.
sentences.chinese: 那样就使这个世界里的一切不同而趋同。

sentences.english: Recent indicators point to greater convergence.
sentences.chinese: 近期指标显示更加趋同。

definition: main stream (of a river)/fig. the essential point/main viewpoint of a matter/mainstream (culture etc)
